alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 11:13PM EDT until April 25 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Michigamme River near Witch Lake affecting Dickinson and Marquette Counties. Sturgeon River near Chassell affecting Baraga and Houghton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Witch Lake. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flood waters cover significant portions of County Road LG between M-95 and Michigamme Dam. Houses near Bengtson Bridge in South Republic are further impacted by flood waters * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:10 PM CDT Wednesday /10:10 PM EDT Wednesday/ the stage was 11.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:10 PM CDT Wednesday /10:10 PM EDT Wednesday/ was 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to very slowly fall from 11.5 feet. It will fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.6 feet on 05/11/1965. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Thursday afternoon at 100 PM CDT /200 PM EDT/.
